frame.name: Create_physical_artwork
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Creator</fen> creates an artifact that is typically an iconic <fen>Representation</fen> of an actual or imagined entity or event. The <fen>Representation</fen> may also be evocative of an idea while not based on resemblance.
<ex><fex name="Representation">Diagrams</fex> must be <fex name="Manner">clearly</fex> <t>drawn</t> <fex name="Location_of_representation">on construction paper</fex>. <fex name="cre">CNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="cre">I</fex> <t>took</t> <fex name="Representation">his picture</fex> and told him that if it came out well I would make him a copy.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Time">In about 1305 and 1306</fex> <fex name="cre">Giotto</fex> <t>painted</t> <fex name="Representation">a notable series of 38 frescoes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Representation</fen> into existence.
<ex>Supposedly, <fex name="cre">the artist</fex> <t>drew</t> the picture from memory.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which a <fen>Representation</fen> is created.
<ex>My brother <t>took</t> this picture in France <fex name="Time">almost 10 years ago</fex>, and has recently scanned it in.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Representation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly.
<ex>Most of us know where we <t>took</t> <fex name="Representation">a photo</fex> but have a harder time remembering the time we took it.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Creator</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies a <fen>Role</fen> that one of the role fillers of the current frame also fills in a background context, either generically or in some specific instance.
</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the <fen>Creator</fen> as being in some state during the creation of the <fen>Representation</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Location_of_representation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The physical location that holds the <fen>Representation</fen>.
<ex>I <t>drew</t> him <fex name="locr">on a sheet of paper</fex> first.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Creator</fen> intends to accomplish by creating the <fen>Representation</fen>.
<ex>Masha also <t>took</t> the picture <fex name="Purpose">to prove that you can find an Internet Cafe even here in Murmansk</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Representation</fen>.
<ex>I <t>took</t> this picture <fex name="Place">in Italy</fex> a couple of weeks ago.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the creation of the <fen>Representation</fen> ogically follows.
<ex>Well, I <t>painted</t> the picture <fex name="Explanation">because the quarry was visually exciting</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity which the <fen>Creator</fen> uses to create the work of art.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An action performed by the <fen>Creator</fen> which brings about the creation of the <fen>Representation</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Reference
FE.definition:
<def-root>A representation of the entity depicted which the <fen>Creator</fen> uses as a reference in the creation of the <fen>Representation</fen>. For instance, another piece of art, a photograph, or his/her memory.
<ex>She <t>sculpted</t> this dragon <fex name="Reference">from a painting of mine</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: paint.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: create a representation by applying (a liquid) to a surface

lexUnit.name: draw.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: produce (a picture or diagram) by making lines and marks on paper.

lexUnit.name: take [picture].v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to produce a photographic image

lexUnit.name: artist.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who practises or performs any of the creative arts.

lexUnit.name: sculpt.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: create a typically three-dimensional physical artwork out of a medium such as clay, glass, etc.

lexUnit.name: cast.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: create a physical artwork by filling a mould with a liquid that will soon harden
